description: Numbers n such that x = 2^n-2 satisfies phi(x)+2=phi(x+2).
comments: Other solutions of this equation are in A001838.Also, n such that 2^(n-1)-1 is prime. Proof: If x=2^n-2, phi(x)+2=phi(x+2) <==> phi(2^n-2)+2=phi(2^n) <==> phi(2(2^(n-1)-1)) + 2 = 2^n(1-1/2) <==> phi(2)*phi(2^(n-1)-1)+2=2^(n-1) <==> phi(2^(n-1)-1) = 2^(n-1)-2 if y=2^(n-1)-1. We have ph(y)=y-1 <==> y=2^(n-1)-1 is prime. Therefore a(n) = A000043(n)+1. - Mohammed Bouayoun (bouyao(AT)wanadoo.fr), Mar 19 2004
example: phi(2^18-2)+2=131072=phi(2^18), so 18 is in the sequence.
